intro: Lomatium foeniculaceum subsp. foeniculaceum, commonly known as the western lomatium, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and forest edges, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided, fern-like segments, and it produces small, yellowish flowers in late spring. The roots are often harvested for their medicinal properties, which have been used by Indigenous peoples for centuries.
